page.title: 01Clady and District
page.content: This is an area of low undulating ground, sloping gently downward to the east, traversed in a west, east direction by the Clady River. It is predominantly cultivate pasture with some arble. Bogland provides peat for domestic fuel. There are two villages, Clady and Inishrush, the majority of whose inhabitants rent houses built in recent years. Most of the inhabitants live rurally. Their houses are mostly modern and owner occupied. The farms are almost all owner occupied, and between 30 - 60 acres in size. Many of the villagers and farmers sons are tradesmen who travel out of the area to work. Some men combine farming with other employment.
